title: Frogs vs Toads: What's the Difference?

myths.myth: Frogs and toads are completely different animals
myths.truth: All toads are actually frogs! 'Toad' is just a common name for frogs that have dry, bumpy skin. Scientists call them all 'anurans' (the order Anura).

myths.myth: Touching a toad will give you warts
myths.truth: Warts are caused by a human virus, not toads! Those bumps on toads are actually glands that help them stay moist and can produce toxins to deter predators.
While many frogs need water to breed, some species live in trees, underground, or even in deserts! The Purple Frog spends most of its life underground.
Frogs come in almost every color imaginable! Blue poison dart frogs, red tomato frogs, and yes, purple frogs all exist in nature.
The mucus on frog skin is actually amazing! It keeps them hydrated, protects against bacteria, and some frogs even produce substances that scientists use to make medicine.
